attributes.action: Don't introduce in schools the rule where every child in the class needs to get an invite for a party
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The boy's school says he has violated the children's rights and has complained to the Swedish Parliament. 

The school, in Lund, southern Sweden, argues that if invitations are handed out on school premises then it must ensure there is no discrimination. 

This rule should not be applied to British schools. Kids should determine who goes to their parties. Plus not everyone in a class are friends with each other. If this silly rule was applied, parents have to spend more money on parties and will be more stressful as there will be more tears and tantrums due to the fact the children know there are some children that should not be there. The govt, LEAs and schools should take note. Children should invite who they want to attend their party.
